Name: Providing stipends for community board members
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing stipends for community board members
BodyName: Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations, State & Federal Legislation

Summary: This bill would require that community board members receive a stipend of $25 per hour, a total of no more than $100 per month, for their attendance at official community board meetings, including hearings and committee meetings.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision c of section 2800 of the New York city charter, as amended by local law number 102 for the year 1977, is amended to read as follows:
      c. [Members] Each member of a community [boards] board shall [serve as such without compensation but] receive a stipend in the amount of $25 for each hour that the member has attended a meeting or hearing held under subdivision h of this section or a meeting held under subdivision i of this section, not to exceed $100 per month. Each member of a community board shall additionally be reimbursed for actual and necessary out-of-pocket expenses in connection with attendance at regularly scheduled meetings of the community board.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
